issue.title: Build SplitSync (Expense Sharing App) - Repository Dispatch Test
issue.body:
Build SplitSync, a modern expense sharing application similar to Splitwise.

## Tech Stack
- Next.js 16.1.4 with App Router
- TypeScript 5.9.3
- Drizzle ORM with SQLite
- Socket.io for real-time updates
- Tailwind CSS + shadcn/ui for UI
- Playwright for E2E testing

## Core Features
1. User authentication and session management
2. Group creation and management (users can create expense-sharing groups)
3. Expense tracking (who paid, split type, amount, date, description, category)
4. Multiple split methods (equal, exact amounts, percentages, shares)
5. Balance calculations (who owes whom)
6. Settlement tracking (partial and full settlements)
7. Real-time updates via WebSocket
8. Expense activity feed

## Requirements
- Complete database schema with all tables
- Authentication with secure password hashing
- RESTful API for all operations
- Responsive UI with modern design
- Real-time updates using Socket.io
- E2E tests with Playwright

The implementation should be production-ready with proper error handling, validation, and edge cases covered.

ems.task: Set up project foundation: create Next.js 16 project with TypeScript, configure ESLint/Prettier, set up Tailwind CSS, create package.json with all dependencies, add .gitignore, tsconfig.json, next.config.js, CI/CD workflow (.github/workflows/ci.yml with lint/typecheck/test/build), Docker files, .env.example, and comprehensive README

analysisSummary: Build SplitSync - a modern expense sharing application with Next.js 16, Drizzle ORM, and Socket.io. Features include user authentication, group expense management, multiple split methods, real-time balance updates, and settlement tracking with comprehensive E2E tests.

pendingEMs.task: Create database schema with Drizzle ORM: design and implement all tables (users, groups, group_members, expenses, expense_splits, settlements, activity_feed), set up SQLite connection, create migrations, define repositories for data access, add indexes and constraints

Implement authentication system: create password hashing utilities with bcrypt, build login/register API endpoints, implement session management with JWT cookies, add authentication middleware, create auth context/provider, build login and registration pages

Build group management features: create group CRUD API endpoints, implement member invitation/management logic, build group creation/list pages, add group detail view, create member management UI components

Implement expense tracking core: create expense API endpoints with all CRUD operations, build expense form components with split type selection (equal/exact/percentage/shares), implement validation logic, create expense detail and list views

Build balance calculation engine: implement debt simplification algorithm (minimize transactions), calculate net balances for all users, create balance display components, build 'who owes whom' visualization, add balance summary API endpoints

Implement settlement tracking: create settlement API endpoints for recording payments, build settlement form UI, add partial settlement support, create settlement history view, implement settlement status updates, add settlement activity logging

Build real-time updates with Socket.io: set up WebSocket server, implement event broadcasting for expenses/settlements/groups, create React hooks for real-time subscriptions, add live update indicators, handle connection/disconnection states

Create activity feed and notifications: implement activity feed API with filtering/pagination, build activity feed UI components, add notification system for relevant events, create unread indicators, implement activity item rendering for different event types

Build reusable UI components with shadcn/ui: implement buttons, forms, cards, modals, dropdowns, tabs, avatars, badges, and other common components, set up proper theming, ensure responsive design across all components

Implement E2E tests with Playwright: set up test environment, write tests for authentication flows, test group creation/management, test expense creation with all split types, test balance calculations, test settlements, test real-time updates, ensure all critical paths are covered
